page.title: 01PYRFORD AREA: INTRODUCTION.
page.content: This block, 30 miles S.W. of London, contains the villages of Ockham and Wisley and parts of Pyrford and Ripley, each different in character. PYRFORD, though much developed with in filling & a large housing estate,keeps its rural identity. WISLEY,belongs to the Royal Horticultural Society. Its Saxon name, "Wet Meadow",explains lack of development. RIPLEY, now by-passed, is still a busy area with shops, inns and a large green. OCKHAM remains an undeveloped real village. All these communities are low-lying, with no hills, Pyrford being 130ft above sea level. All have attractive old buildings but are short of low cost housing. It is an affluent area with cars rather than public transport. The future of this farming-cum commuting area depends on the effect of the M25, and Wisley airfield/green belt policy.
